title: Building Commitment to Decisions
content: Good decisions poorly executed fail. Commitment comes from involvement, understanding, and alignment. When people understand why a decision was made and had opportunity to contribute, they commit to execution even if they initially disagreed. Explain your reasoning, acknowledge trade-offs, and address concerns before expecting commitment.

mcq.question: You've made a decision the team doesn't fully support. How do you build commitment?

options.B: Explain your reasoning, acknowledge their concerns, and be clear about expected execution
options.C: Revisit the decision to achieve consensus
options.D: Let them execute their own way

mcq.explanation: Commitment follows understanding. Explain why you decided as you did, acknowledge valid concerns, and clarify expectations. People can commit to decisions they disagreed with if they understand the reasoning.

openQuestions: How do you build commitment when the team doesn't fully agree with a decision?
When has lack of commitment undermined execution of a good decision?
